courses.title: Engineering Graphics for Civil and Environmental Engineering
courses.description: Introduction to engineering graphics for CEE covering sketching, computer-aided design, and essential concepts for the interpretation of design drawings.

courses.title: Exploring Civil and Environmental Engineering
courses.description: A course for introducing new CEE students to the fields of civil and environmental engineering framed within cross-cutting topic areas.

courses.title: Introduction to Engineering Graphics and Visualization
courses.description: Engineering graphics and visualization including sketching, line drawing, and solid modeling.Development and interpretation of drawings and specification for product realization. Crosslisted with AE and ME 1770.

courses.title: Dynamics
courses.description: Kinematics and kinetics of particles and rigid bodies in one and two dimensions; principles of work/energy and impulse/momentum.

courses.title: Civil and Environmental Engineering Systems
courses.description: Infrastructure viewed from a systems perspective; planning, analytical and evaluation approaches for civil- and environmental-engineered facilities; sustainability - engineering economy; environmental and social quality of life considerations.

courses.title: Environmental Engineering Principles
courses.description: Introduction to chemical, biological, and physical processes in the environment. Discussion of the basic processes governing air, water, and land quality, and the behavior and impacts of contaminants associated with human and industrial activities.

courses.title: Undergraduate Research Assistantship
courses.description: Independent research conducted under the guidance of a faculty member.

courses.title: Undergraduate Research
courses.description: Independent research conducted under the guidance of a faculty member.

courses.title: Special Topics
courses.description: Special Topics in CEE.

courses.title: Civil Engineering Systems
courses.description: Infrastructure viewed from a systems perspective; analytical approaches and modeling of civil-engineered facilities; sustainability; engineering economy applications.

courses.title: Geomatics
courses.description: Spatial data collection methods including surveying, photogrammetry, remote sensing, and global positioning systems; management, manipulation, and analysis of spatial and associated attribute data.

courses.title: Civil Engineering Materials
courses.description: Physical, mechanical, and durability properties of concrete, metals, unreinforced and reinforced plastics, timber, asphalt, and asphalt concrete.

courses.title: Fluid Mechanics
courses.description: Elementary mechanics of fluids with emphasis on hydrostatics, control volume analysis of flowing fluids using kinematics, continuity, energy, and momentum principles; similitude, pipe flow.

courses.title: Introduction to Structural Engineering
courses.description: Concepts in structural engineering related to the analysis and design of various types of structures such that they behave as intended throughout their lifetime.

courses.title: Introduction to Structural Engineering for the Global Engineering Leadership Minor
courses.description: Concepts in structural engineering related to the analysis and design of various types of structures such that they behave as intended throughout their lifetime.

courses.title: Structural Analysis
courses.description: Determination of internal forces and deflection in statically determinate trusses, beams, and frames. Introduction to analysis of statically indeterminate structures.

courses.title: Data Analytics in Civil and Environmental Engineering
courses.description: Data analytics applications for CEE, accessing and assessing datasets, tools focused on machine learning, advantages and limitations of data driven approaches, communication data-driven assessments.

courses.title: Environmental Engineering Laboratory
courses.description: Theory and application of environmental laboratory methods for measurement of fundamental properties and characteristics of dissolved and particulate constituents in water, air and soil systems.

courses.title: Introduction to Geotechnical Engineering
courses.description: Introduction to soil as an engineering material, with a focus on the mechanics of soil strength and compressibility, and fluid flow through soils.

courses.title: Statistics and Applications
courses.description: Introduction to probability, probability distributions, point estimation, confidence intervals, hypothesis testing, linear regression, and analysis of variance. Example applied to the field of civil and environmental engineering. Crosslisted with MATH 3770 and ISYE 3770. Also, credit not awarded for both CEE 3770 and MATH 3670.

courses.title: Global Engineering Leadership
courses.description: Addresses skills necessary for the global engineer-leader: creating an engineering firm and evaluating its global viability; written, oral, and cross-cultural communication; collaboration; ethics; strategic planning.

courses.title: Innovation & Entrepreneurship in CEE Systems
courses.description: This course highlights opportunities for innovation and entrepreneurship in Civil and Environmental Engineering Systems, and the essential components of forming, pitching, and starting a business.

courses.title: Infrastructure System Management
courses.description: Introduction to general concepts and advanced topics in infrastructure systems management applied to manage large-scale infrastructure assets.

courses.title: Capstone Design
courses.description: An interdisciplinary civil and environmental design experience.  Problem definition, data acquisition, modeling and analysis, evaluation of design alternatives, oral and written presentation of final design.

courses.title: Construction Engineering and Management
courses.description: Fundamental concepts in planning, design, and construction of civil engineering projects.  Introduction to project scheduling, cost estimating, controls, procurement, value engineering, quality assurance, and safety.

courses.title: Construction Seminar
courses.description: The seminar provides a platform for students to engage with construction industry companies and experts, to learn about different construction disciplines, their projects, and experiences.

courses.title: Construction Planning, Estimating, and Scheduling
courses.description: An integrated approach to planning, estimating, and scheduling of construction projects, including basic and advanced concepts, applications, and tools for developing plans, estimates, and schedules.

courses.title: Construction Operations
courses.description: An integrated approach to construction methods, including basic and advanced concepts, applications, and tools for planning, analysis, and assessment of construction methods and equipment.

courses.title: Construction Safety and Health
courses.description: Fundamentals to safety and health as they apply to civil infrastructure and building construction.  Topics include planning, design, management, rules and guidelines, best practices, and inspection of safety and health.

courses.title: Building Information Modeling (BIM) in Construction
courses.description: Theory and Application of Building Information Modeling ( BIM) in the Architecture/Engineering/Construction (A/E/C) industry with emphasis on Constructability, Scheduling.  Front End Planning (FEP) and Construction monitoring.

courses.title: Construction Management & Megaprojects
courses.description: Covers planning and development of megaprojects. Addresses social, environmental, and economic impacts of megaprojects. Discusses cultural differences & ethical issues in managing megaprojects.

courses.title: Smart and Sustainable Cities
courses.description: This course examines city infrastructure systems’ impact on urban sustainability. It further explores the role of “smart” technological solutions to address mounting urban sustainability challenges.

courses.title: AI For Smart Cities
courses.description: Study of a new system approach of problem-solving using AI for Smart Cities. including 3 key elements and 3 core methods.

courses.title: Construction Law
courses.description: Overview includes legal concepts, the mechanics of the judicial system, professional liability and other legal issues as they pertain to construction engineers.

courses.title: Infrastructure Finance
courses.description: Methods, models, and best practices including revenue, capital flow, funding and financing of infrastructure. Covers decision process, engineering economics, microeconomics, financial statement analysis, and risk.

courses.title: Hydraulic Engineering
courses.description: Applications of fluid mechanics to engineering and natural systems including fluid drag, open channel flow, turbomachinery, and environmental hydraulics; laboratory experiments; computational hydraulics.

courses.title: Hydrology
courses.description: Global circulation and the hydrologic cycle, precipitation mechanisms and analysis, evaporation and other losses, streamflow, hydrographs, river and reservoir routing, and frequency analysis.

courses.title: Water Resources Systems
courses.description: Components and services of water resources systems; and planning and management approaches in the face of climatic, environmental, and socio-economic change.

courses.title: Introduction to Coastal Engineering
courses.description: Introduction to coastal engineering processes and problems. Topics include: water wave mechanics, nearshore hydrodynamics, astronomical tides, sediment transport, beach nourishment, and coastal structures.

courses.title: Environmental Engineering Systems
courses.description: Environmental engineering issues associated with water, air, and land pollution, including risk assessment, groundwater contamination, global climate change, and sustainable technologies.

courses.title: Water Quality Engineering
courses.description: Reclamation of water and wastewater for potable and industrial uses, groundwater remediation. Principles of physical, chemical, and biological treatment processes.

courses.title: Hazardous Substance Remediation
courses.description: Technical aspects of hazardous waste management and treatment including legislation, exposure and risk assessment, contaminant fate and transport, waste treatment methods, and remediation technologies.

courses.title: Air Pollution Engineering
courses.description: Introduction to the physical and chemical processes affecting the dynamics and fate of air pollutants at the local, regional, and global scales.  Particular emphasis is on tropospheric pollutant chemistry and transport.

courses.title: Environmental Modeling and Health Risk Analysis
courses.description: This course provides an introduction to modeling techniques used in the environmental health field, with emphasis on three different exposure pathways introduced as the air pathway, groundwater pathway, and surface water pathway.

courses.title: Environmental Technology in the Developing World
courses.description: Approaches, methods, and practical aspects of employing technologies for improving environmental quality in low and middle income countries. Team project-based course with field component.

courses.title: Energy and Resource Recovery
courses.description: This is an upper level course to introduce the technical aspects of achieving a more sustainable world by energy and resource recovery. Specifically, this course will cover both renewable energy and solid waste management.

courses.title: Industrial Wastewater Process Engineering and Design
courses.description: Upper level course addressing challenging, high strength industrial wastewater treatment plant design, including associated regulatory, treatability, process engineering, materials of construction, and industrial setting considerations.

courses.title: Environmental Systems Design Project
courses.description: Design and assessment of an environmental system, component or process, including problem definition, data acquisition, modeling and analysis, evaluation of alternatives, and presentations.

courses.title: Introduction to Geotechnical Engineering
courses.description: Introduction to soil as an engineering material, with a focus on the mechanics of soil strength and compressibility, and fluid flow through soils.

courses.title: Applied Geotechnics
courses.description: Geotechnical principles applied to civil engineering construction, including evaluation of soil and rock properties, shallow foundations, drive and bored pilings, liquefaction, and ground modification.  Credit not allowed for both CEE 4406 and CEE 4410.

courses.title: Subsurface Characterization
courses.description: Introduction to field and laboratory methods for characterizing subsurface geological, hydrological, geotechnical, and contaminant conditions.

courses.title: Environmental Geotechnics
courses.description: Chemical equilibria and partitioning in subsurface systems; hazardous waste site assessment technologies and data; including soil gas data, monitoring wells, and direct-push technology.

courses.title: Introduction to Petroleum Geomechanics
courses.description: Introduction to the basic concepts of geomechanics and their engineering applications with a focus on the petroleum - and energy - related applications.

courses.title: International Disaster Reconnaissance
courses.description: Reviews consequence of and response to foreign disasters in light of technical, cultural and political factors; disasters include earthquakes, floods, hurricanes/typhoons, and man-made infrastructure failures.

courses.title: Structural Steel Design
courses.description: Principles of behavior of tension and compression members, beams, and connections with application to the design of elementary structures.

courses.title: Reinforced Concrete Design
courses.description: Principles of behavior of reinforced concrete beams, short columns, and slabs, with application to the design of elementary concrete structures, foundation, and earth- retaining structures.

courses.title: Timber and Masonry Design
courses.description: Stress-based design of tension, compression, and flexural members; design of building systems, unreinforced and reinforced walls using timber and masonry construction materials and techniques.

courses.title: Infrastructure Rehabilitation
courses.description: Rehabilitation of civil infrastructure systems including aspects of deterioration science, nondestructive assessment, renewal engineering, construction planning and management, and public policy and finance.

courses.title: Structural Analysis II
courses.description: Analysis of two- and three-dimensional statically indeterminate structures by classical and matrix methods of solution. Flexibility and stiffness techniques, influence lines, approximate analysis, and nonlinear analysis.

courses.title: Historic Structures
courses.description: Course examines some of the world’s great structures from an engineering and structural art perspective while integrating architecture and history-based concepts.

courses.title: Introduction to Finite Element Methods
courses.description: Introduction to Finite Element Methods in Civil Engineering. Formulation of FE numerical methods for solving engineering problems applied to trusses, frames and 2D continuum problems.

courses.title: Origami Engineering
courses.description: This class acquaints the student with the state-of-art concepts and algorithms to design and analyze origami structures, assemblages, and tessellations.

courses.title: Transportation Planning, Operations, and Design
courses.description: Introduction to transportation engineering with specific emphasis on the planning, design, and operation of transportation facilities.

courses.title: Multimodal Transportation Planning, Design, and Operations
courses.description: Planning, design, and operation of systems of air, rail, water, and highway facilities, including those for bicycles and pedestrians.

courses.title: Environmental Impact Assessment
courses.description: Key policy, planning, and methodological issues in the environmental impact assessment of engineering systems including the regulatory framework and analytical techniques.

courses.title: Freeway and Interchange Planning and Design
courses.description: An introduction to the planning and design of freeways and interchanges.  Topics include various interchange forms, HOV lanes, ramp metering, tolling, and truck by-pass ramps.

courses.title: Site Development Planning and Design in Transportation
courses.description: An introduction to the planning and design of site developments.  Topics include site traffic analysis and driveway, parking lot, drive-thru facility, site circulation, delivery facility and residential neighborhood design.

courses.title: Sustainable Transportation Abroad
courses.description: Planning, design, and operations of transportation systems in countries with sustainable multimodal infrastructure; applying lessons learned to US; leadership development in context of sustainable technologies.

courses.title: Introduction to Transportation and Public Health
courses.description: Examines the linkage between transportation and human health in both a population and occupational sense. Explores how public and private decision making and the engineering design of transportation systems influences public health.

courses.title: Undergraduate Research Assistantship
courses.description: Independent research conducted under the guidance of a faculty member.

courses.title: Undergraduate Research
courses.description: Independent research conducted under the guidance of a faculty member.

courses.title: Mechanical Behavior of Composites
courses.description: Stress-strain behavior of composites, property of matrix and reinforcing materials, mechanics of fiber-reinforced composites, lamina and laminate analysis, and mechanical performance. Crosslisted with AE, CHE, ME, MSE, and PTFE 4791.

courses.title: Composite Materials and Processes
courses.description: Basic principles of selection and design of composite materials and their manufacturing and testing. Cost factors. Laboratory exercises on manufacturing and tests. Crosslisted with AE, CHE, ME, MSE, and PTFE 4793.

courses.title: Composite Materials and Manufacturing
courses.description: Basic principles of selection and design of composite materials and their manufacturing and testing. Cost factors. Laboratory exercises on manufacturing and tests. Crosslisted with AE, CHE, ME, MSE, and PTFE 4794.

courses.title: Groundwater Hydrology
courses.description: Dynamics of flow and solute transport in groundwater, including theory, implementation, and case studies. Crosslisted with EAS 4795.

courses.title: Undergraduate Honors Research Project
courses.description: Individual research projects conducted in conjunction with and under the direction of a CEE faculty member. Participation by invitation, and agreement with individual faculty members.  Project culminates in a thesis and presentation.

courses.title: Construction Project Planning
courses.description: Introduction to project planning concepts including organization development, computer-based scheduling, computer-based estimating, regulatory agencies, and project financing.

courses.title: Computer Applications in Construction
courses.description: Introduction to computing tools impacting the construction industry and the analysis techniques used to determine company automation requirements.

courses.title: Construction Industry Best Practices
courses.description: Front End Planning, Risk Assessment and Dispute Prevention, Constructability, Advanced Work Packaging, Planning for Startup, Change and Material managements, Alignment, Modularization, Quality Control, Zero Accident Techniques.

courses.title: Construction Project Controls
courses.description: Introduction to project control concepts and advanced implementation techniques.  Project control concerns including project budgeting, project productivity, cash flow, and resource allocation will be introduced.

courses.title: Advanced Planning and Estimating Methods
courses.description: Overview of advanced methods for planning and estimating construction projects including resource allocation/management, project control techniques, interpretation of schedules and estimates, and value engineering.

courses.title: Construction Law
courses.description: Overview of construction law and legal issues encountered by the construction engineer and manager.

courses.title: Safety Engineering
courses.description: Application of pro-active safety engineering approaches including theories of accident causation, human error classification, prevention through design, safety knowledge transfer and safety leading indicators.

courses.title: Project Delivery and Procurement
courses.description: Analysis of construction project delivery including traditional, design-build, construction management, multiple prime contractors, and related financing. The course focuses on the owner's role in construction.

courses.title: Automation in Construction
courses.description: Introduction to construction automation, robotics, AI, sensing, and 3D visualization. An integrated approach to design and assess new automated construction technologies using needs assessment, AHP, and economic feasibility analyses.

courses.title: Construction Field Engineering
courses.description: Introduction to construction engineering techniques and practices including site excavation, shoring structures, heavy equipment, site layout, and temporary facility construction.

courses.title: Coastal Mechanics
courses.description: Introduction to physical and mathematical descriptions of the major coastal processes: including linear wave mechanics, nearshore circulation, and ocean tides.

courses.title: Coastal Structures
courses.description: Introduction to coastal structures with a focus on the hydrodynamic loading and the resulting analysis, design and potential failure mechanisms during extreme events.

courses.title: Physical Hydrology
courses.description: Occurrence, movement, and distribution of water.  Topics: hydrologic cycle, global circulation, climate, atmospheric water vapor, thermodynamics, precipitation, evaporation, snowmelt, soil moisture, unsaturated flow, infiltration, geomorphology, runoff, and routing.

courses.title: Hydrometeorology
courses.description: Estimation of hydrologic variables from on-site and remote sensors; operational hydrologic models; parameter estimation; operational forecasting.

courses.title: Coastal Engineering
courses.description: Introduction to coastal engineering processes and problems. Topics include: water wave mechanics, nearshore hydrodynamics, astronomical tides, sediment transport, beach nourishment, and coastal structures.

courses.title: Probability and Statistics for Civil and Environmental
courses.description: Engineers Probability distributions applicable to civil engineering Systems; function of random variables; regression and correlation analysis; parameters estimation and statistical hypothesis tests.

courses.title: Stochastic Hydrology
courses.description: Stochastic modeling of hydrologic processes.  Problems of model specifications and parameter identification, and validation.  Application to forecasting and synthetic events.

courses.title: Water Resources Management I
courses.description: Operations research methodologies, including linear and nonlinear programming, and their applications to water resources systems.

courses.title: Water Resources Management II
courses.description: Design of decision support systems for water resources planning and management.

courses.title: Random Fields and Geostatistics
courses.description: Probability density function; moments; scales of fluctuations; spectral representation; simulation of random fields; cross-correlated random fields; vector fields; kriging; conditional simulation.

courses.title: Intermediate Fluid Mechanics
courses.description: Concepts of linear and angular deformation, vorticity, and conservation of mass.  Development of Navier-Stokes with solutions: steady and unsteady uniform laminar, vortex, creeping, and potential flow.

courses.title: Advanced Fluid Mechanics
courses.description: Theory of three-dimensional turbulent boundary layers with application to environmental flows in rivers, estuaries, and the atmosphere of interest in water resources engineering.

courses.title: Environmental Fluid Mechanics
courses.description: Dynamics, mixing, and contaminant transport in surface water bodies, including lakes, rivers, estuaries, and coastal waters.  Introduction to numerical models.  Prediction of mixing zones.

courses.title: Advanced Environmental Fluid Mechanics
courses.description: Buoyancy modifications to the mixing and dynamics of pollutant discharges and surface water bodies.  Gathering and analysis of laboratory and field data for mixing problems.

courses.title: Flow and Transport through Porous Media I
courses.description: Basic principles governing ground water flow.  Topics covered: fundamental principles of saturated and unsaturated ground water flow, contaminant transport, and salt water intrusion.

courses.title: Open Channel Hydraulics
courses.description: Flow of liquids with free surfaces in artificial and natural channels.  Analysis of flow resistance. Computation of gradually varied flow profiles.  Flow through transitions, spillways, bridges, culverts. Analysis of unsteady flow.

courses.title: Sediment Transport
courses.description: Engineering importance of erosion and sedimentation problems.  Topics: properties of non-cohesive/cohesive sediments including specific weight/gravity/shape/size/ size distribution/fall velocity/mineral structure/ rheological properties.

courses.title: Hydraulic Transients in Fluid Systems
courses.description: Transient flow of liquids in piping systems. One-dimensional wave equations and method of characteristics. Effects of valves and pumps on water hammer. Cavitation and liquid-column separation.

courses.title: Hydrodynamic Stability and Turbulence
courses.description: Flow in stability and turbulence are important in virtually all environmental flows. Fundamental stability, transition, and turbulent concepts along with their engineering relevance will be introduced.

courses.title: Process Principles in Environmental Engineering
courses.description: Principles that can be used in the analysis and modeling of environmental engineering processes, including material and energy balances, mass transfer, and reaction engineering.

courses.title: Microbial Principles in Environmental Engineering
courses.description: Microbiological principles with emphasis on microbial nutrition and growth, inhibition and control of growth, biochemical thermodynamics, metabolic pathways, enzyme and microbial kinetics.

courses.title: Chemical Principles in Environmental Engineering
courses.description: Fundamental principles of chemical equilibria and environmental organic chemistry in dilute aqueous systems with emphasis on chemical speciation and environmental engineering applications.

courses.title: Fate of Contaminants in the Subsurface
courses.description: Effects of physical, chemical, and biological processes on the fate and transport of contaminants in unsaturated and saturated porous media.

courses.title: Fundamentals of Environmental Modeling and Mathematics
courses.description: This course is designed to provide an understanding of fundamental principles and approaches used in modeling environmental systems, as well as the necessary mathematical techniques.

courses.title: Environmental Nanotechnology
courses.description: The course is divided into two primary sections: 1) fundamentals of nanomaterials and nanotechnology and 2) the environmental applications of nanotechnology.

courses.title: Environmental Sciences and Engineering Laboratory
courses.description: Laboratory exercises and discussions for the understanding of fundamental chemical analytical, physicochemical, and applied microbiological principles in environmental engineering.

courses.title: Legal, Institutional, and Policy Frameworks for Water Resources Planning and Management
courses.description: Fundamental principles of national and international water policy, legislation and management frameworks for transboundary water resources management.

courses.title: Water Quality and Ecology in Lakes and Rivers
courses.description: Mixing/transport of pollutants and natural substances in surface waters, lakes, rivers, estuaries, coastal waters. Application of mathematical models of hydrodynamics and water quality to these water bodies.

courses.title: Water Resources Systems Analysis
courses.description: The policy, legal, and institutional contexts of water resources planning and management, information and modeling systems, modeling tools, and the practical experience with the use of decision support systems.

courses.title: Natural Resources and Environmental Economics
courses.description: Relation between economic and ecological systems, case studies and examples, tools of environmental policy, environmental economic evaluation.

courses.title: Water Supply and Sanitation
courses.description: Sanitation, wastewater characterization, wastewater treatment process analysis and selection, pre-treatment options, biological treatment, removal of pollutants biosolids treatment and disposal, and safe water systems.

courses.title: River Hydraulics
courses.description: Open channel hydraulics, fluvial geomorphology, flood control structures, culverts, bridge openings, river bed and bank stability control measures.

courses.title: Hydrologic Principles aned Practices
courses.description: Hydrologic cycle, global circulation, climate, atmospheric water vapor, thermodynamics, precipitation, evaporation, snowmelt, soil moisture, unsaturated flow, infiltration, geomorphology, runoff, and routing.

courses.title: Statistical Methods for Environmental Data Analysis and Prediction
courses.description: Provide a good understanding of the fundamental principles of probability/statistics, and demonstrate the application of these principles to environmental data analysis and prediction problems.

courses.title: Physicochemical Processes
courses.description: Theory and application of the physical and chemical processes of coagulation, flocculation, sedimentation, softening, filtration, and disinfection in water and wastewater treatment.

courses.title: Biological Processes
courses.description: Microbial growth kinetics and bioenergetics, theory, modeling, and application of biological processes employed in water, wastewater, and hazardous waste treatment systems as well as subsurface bioremediation.

courses.title: Separation Processes
courses.description: Theory and applications of the physical and chemical processes of sorption, membrane separation, and absorption in both gas-phase and liquid-phase environmental engineering systems.

courses.title: Hazardous Waste Site Remediation
courses.description: Selection, design and implementation of hazardous waste site remediation technologies including pump-and-treat, soil vapor extraction, thermal processes, bioremediation, surfactant flushing, and barrier-treatment walls.

courses.title: Industrial Waste Treatment and Disposal
courses.description: A review of current policies and approaches in industrial waste treatment, and application of engineering principles and processes for waste treatment, recovery, and disposal.

courses.title: Solid Waste Technology
courses.description: An introduction of the current regulations and fundamentals of solid waste management, characterization, handling, recycling, transportation, and final disposal systems.

courses.title: Membrane Processes
courses.description: An introduction of the theories of membrane separation processes with special emphasis on desalination, softening, THM precursors reduction using reverse osmosis and nanofiltration.

courses.title: Sustainable Engineering
courses.description: The course is intended to introduce students to the interaction between human and natural environment and provide an overview on the emerging science of sustainability.

courses.title: Advanced Environmental Chemistry
courses.description: Chemical behavior of inorganic and organic compounds in natural waters.  Topics include chemistry of metal ions, partitioning and distribution of organic pollutants, surface reactions.

courses.title: Biotransformation of Xenobiotic Compounds
courses.description: Biotransformation pathways and kinetics of anthropogenic recalcitrant compounds and biological, biochemical, and environmental factors affecting these transformations in natural and engineered systems.

courses.title: Industrial Ecology in Environmental Engineering
courses.description: Introduces the principles of environmentally conscious products, processes, and manufacturing systems.

courses.title: Design of Treatment Facilities for Drinking Water
courses.description: Theory and design of process tanks and equipment for capture, purification, conditioning, storage, and distribution of safe drinking water.

courses.title: Modeling and Simulation of Biological Treatment Systems
courses.description: Theory and design of biological treatment systems for water reclamation, nutrient removal, and integrated process design and optimization using advanced computer models.

courses.title: Air Pollutant Formation and Control
courses.description: Analysis of air pollutants through the study of radical reaction pathways, combustion processes, and removal of particles and gaseous pollutants from exhaust gas streams.

courses.title: Soil Mechanics
courses.description: Fundamental concepts related to the mechanical behavior of soils, including: effective stress, strength, stiffness, permeability, time-dependent behavior.

courses.title: Laboratory Characterization of Geomaterials
courses.description: Instruction in the procedures, methods of interpretation and apparatus limitations and influences for geotechnical laboratory index, strength, deformation, and permeability tests.

courses.title: Experimental Methods in Research
courses.description: Topics in experimental research include: scale effects, similarity, falsification, errors, transducers, design of experiments.

courses.title: In-Situ Testing and Site Characterization of Geomaterials
courses.description: Field testing and sampling of geomaterials, primarily soils and rocks.  Introduces methods of drilling, probing, and in-situ measurement of soils for determining stratigraphy and engineering parameters for analysis, including soil borings, cone penetration tests, pressuremeter, dilatometer, and other tests.

courses.title: Engineering Geophysics
courses.description: Geophysical techniques used to characterize near-surface soils and rocks including seismic, magnetic, electromagnetic, radar, and resistivity methods.

courses.title: Finite Element Method for Coupled Processes In Elastic Porous Media
courses.description: Poroelasticity, variational methods, space and time discretization. FEM for solid mechanics, heat/mass transfer and coupled stress/pressure/temperature variations in porous media, e.g. soils, rocks,concrete, bones.

courses.title: Analysis of Earth Structures
courses.description: Instruction in techniques for assessing the stability of earth-retaining structures including unreinforced slopes, reinforced slopes, free-standing retaining structures, and reinforced retaining structures.

courses.title: Dynamic Analysis in Geotechnical Engineering
courses.description: Dynamic soil properties; response of foundations to dynamic loads; construction and blast vibration criteria; dynamic analysis of pile driving; introduction to liquefaction potential.

courses.title: Foundation Systems
courses.description: Evaluation and design of foundations for civil engineering structures, including the settlement and bearing capacity of shallow spread footings, mats, and deep foundations. Footings, driven piles, bored piles, and drilled shafts analyzed using elastic continuum theory, limit plasticity, and cavity expansion solutions, supplemented with numerous case studies. Ancillary topics include axial load transfer, pile group interaction, lateral and moment loading, and pile dynamics.

courses.title: Geosynthetics in Civil Engineering
courses.description: Development, fabrication, design, and applications of geotextiles, geogrids, geonets, and geomembranes.

courses.title: Geotechnical Earthquake Engineering
courses.description: Earthquake magnitude and intensity, seismic hazard evaluation using deterministic and probabilistic approaches, site response analyses and ground motion amplification liquefaction, and response of earth structures.

courses.title: Ground Modification
courses.description: Methods for improving marginal construction sites for geotechnical engineering projects and rehabilitation of geoinfrastructure.

courses.title: Landfill Design and Management
courses.description: The course deals with geomaterial selection and characterization, chemical compatibility, placement procedures (including compaction), design strategies, seepage issues, instrumentation, and environmental monitoring.

courses.title: Design of Remediation Systems
courses.description: Design of remediation systems and management approaches for the petrochemical, power generation, metals finishing, and mining industries are emphasized. Risk analysis and case histories are presented.

courses.title: Rock Mechanics
courses.description: Rock characterization, scale effect, in-situ stresses, mechanisms of rock deformation and fracture, rock engineering; special attention to common principles unifying presented set of topics.

courses.title: Theoretical Geomechanics
courses.description: Field equations of linear elasticity, solutions of boundary value problems, steady/transient flow in porous media. Yielding and failure of soils; plasticity theory and limit analyses.  Constitutive soil models.  Introduction to finite elements with geotechnical engineering applications.

courses.title: Mathematical Applications for Civil and Environmental
courses.description: Mathematical techniques are reviewed in the context of CEE problems.  The simplified yet mathematically rigorous approach highlights the internal mathematical connections between different engineering problems.

courses.title: Signals and Inverse Problems in Civil Engineering
courses.description: Civil engineering signals and systems.  Discrete time and frequency domain operations.  Nonlinear and nonstationary systems.  Inverse problems. Matrix-based and other solutions. Tomography. Civil engineering examples.

courses.title: Constitutive Modeling of Soils
courses.description: Fundamental concepts in modeling behavior of soils. Implementation of models into numerical solution codes. Evaluation of models used in practice.

courses.title: Unsaturated Soil Mechanics
courses.description: This course presents many of the fundamental concepts behind the mechanical behavior of unsaturated soils.

courses.title: Geotechnical Image and Spatial Analysis
courses.description: Presentation of techniques for spatial and image processing and analysis of subsurface data at micro and macro scales.

courses.title: Industrial Byproduct Reutilization
courses.description: Explores more fully the interface between geotechnology, geochemistry, and sustainable engineering to develop new applications using industrial byproducts.

courses.title: Matrix Structural Analysis
courses.description: Static analysis of framed structures by flexibility and stiffness methods; computer models and solution for applied loads, temperature, support settlement, and member prestrain effects.

courses.title: Finite Element Method of Structural Analysis
courses.description: Introduction to the element method with emphasis on analysis of solids and structures.  One-, two-, and three-dimensional finite.  Modeling, approximations, and errors.

courses.title: Nonlinear Finite Element Analysis
courses.description: Lagrangian formulations for nonlinear analysis of solids and structures, including consistent linearization and state determination.  Incremental-iterative solution approaches; computational plasticity. Software implementation.

courses.title: Structural Dynamics
courses.description: Vibration and dynamic response of structures to periodic and general time-dependent loads, with and without damping effects. Both SDOF and MDOF structural systems are discussed.

courses.title: Structural Dynamics
courses.description: Vibration and dynamic response of linear and nonlinear structures to periodic and general disturbing forces, with and without damping effects.  Wind and earthquake SDOF and MDOF effects.

courses.title: Random Vibration
courses.description: Stochastic processes as tools for modeling time-dependent structural excitations; random dynamic response of structural systems to time-dependent forces; reliability of dynamic structural systems.

courses.title: Advanced Dynamics and Smart Structures
courses.description: Overview of advanced dynamics and smart structures. Topics include vibration modal analysis, signal processing, modern sensors technologies, structural monitoring, and structural control.

courses.title: Computational Methods in Mechanics
courses.description: Generalization of finite element concepts; Galerkin-weighted residual and variational approaches; mixed and hybrid finite element formulations, applications, transient dynamic analysis; software implementation.

courses.title: Reinforced Concrete Members
courses.description: Behavior and design of RC members; ductility and inelastic response; deep beams; corbel and torsion design; column biaxial bending; shearwalls; effects of creep and shrinkage.

courses.title: Reinforced Concrete Slab Systems
courses.description: Analysis and design of two-way slab systems, structural walls, and complex building configurations. Equivalent frame and analysis, strip and yield-line technique, application of finite element method to design of slab and wall systems.

courses.title: Prestressed Concrete
courses.description: Principles and practice of prestressed concrete.  Analysis and design of statically determinate and indeterminate beams, and one-way and two-way slabs; precast pretensioned, posttensioned.

courses.title: Advanced Structural Steel Design
courses.description: Strength, behavior, and design of steel structures according to WSD and LRFD. Plate girders, composite beams, bolted and welded connections, beam-columns, and torsion.

courses.title: Introduction to Bridge Engineering
courses.description: Introduction to loads, methods of analysis, design, fabrication and construction of girder bridges.

courses.title: Structural Systems
courses.description: Behavior and design of steel and concrete building and bridge systems.  Introduction to structural planning with emphasis on economics, structural behavior, serviceability, and strength considerations.

courses.title: Design of Polymer Composite Structures
courses.description: Strength, behavior, and design of polymeric composites, structural members, and connections for civil engineering applications.

courses.title: Rehabilitation of Existing Structures
courses.description: Deterioration science; corrosion of steel, alkali-silica reaction, freezing and thawing. Assessment and evaluation of existing structures, nondestructive testing, and nondestructive evaluation.

courses.title: Introduction to Non-Destructive Testing and Forensic Evaluation in Structures.
courses.description: Introduction to the theoretical basis and practical application of nondestructive testing with complementary analytical and destructive testing for the forensic investigation of engineering materials and structures.

courses.title: Engineering Risk Analysis
courses.description:
Fundamental concepts of probability theory, risk analysis, and decision theory with applications to engineering systems; Bayesian
methods; uncertainty analysis; risk-informed decision making
.

courses.title: Earthquake Engineering
courses.description: Characteristics of earthquakes; design and rehabilitation of civil engineering structures for earthquake ground motion; code provisions; case studies.

courses.title: Consequence-Based Earthquake Engineering
courses.description: This course will provide focused instruction on earthquake engineering within a Consequence Based Engineering (CBE) framework. The course will reflect the cross-disciplinary nature of earthquake engineering practice and research, and will provide an overview on diverse topics in hazard definition, vulnerability assessment, mitigation measures and societal impact.

courses.title: Structural Modeling
courses.description: Modeling of structures for static, dynamic, and nonlinear analysis using finite elements.  Effects of parameters on the structural behavior.

courses.title: Inelastic Design
courses.description: Application of fundamental theorems of plastic design to beam, frame, and plate structures. Design based on ultimate strength, ductility and capacity design principles.

courses.title: Structural Reliability
courses.description: Concepts and applications of probability and statistics for analysis of risk and reliability of structures subjected to natural and man-made hazards; stochastic load and strength modeling; probabilistic risk assessment; introduction to stochastic computational mechanics.

courses.title: Advanced Strength of Materials
courses.description: Study of advanced topics from mechanics of materials with application to structures.  Typical topics: energy methods, failure theories, post-yield behavior, generalized bending and torsion.

courses.title: Theory of Elastic Stability
courses.description: Concepts of elastic stability, simple mechanical models, buckling of beam-columns and frames, beams on elastic foundation, and plates energy methods, torsional and lateral buckling.

courses.title: Theory of Plates and Shells
courses.description: Plate bending, approximate methods, nonlinearity, stiffened and anisotropic plates.  Stress and deformation of shells with and without bending, surfaces of revolutions, and shallow shells.

courses.title: Applied Elasticity
courses.description: Introduction to traction, stress, and equilibrium; deformations, strain compatibility; constitutive equations; two-dimensional problems in Cartesian and polar coordinates; application to extension, bending, and torsion.

courses.title: Energy Methods in Mechanics
courses.description: Virtual work, principles of potential energy and complementary energy, Castigliano's theorems, generalized and stationary variational principles, energy methods, structural applications, nonlinear problems, Hamilton's principle.

courses.title: Plasticity and Viscoelasticity
courses.description: Plastic deformation, yield conditions, flow rules and normality, relaxation and creep, viscoelasticity, tubes and spheres, torsion and bending, slip line fields, viscoelastic boundary value problems.

courses.title: Wave Propagation in Solids
courses.description: Plane waves in elastic half-spaces, reflection and refraction; Rayleigh and Stonely waves; waveguides, Love waves, Rayleigh-Lamb modes; Cagniard-de Hoop method; in anisotropic media.

courses.title: Experimental Stress Analysis
courses.description: Study of surface stress and strain using brittle coatings and strain gauges.  Strain gauge circuits, static and dynamic problems, transducer design and circuits.

courses.title: Materials Science of Concrete
courses.description: This course integrates fundamental science-based concepts with engineering-based design of concrete toward the development of a more complete understanding of the relationships between materials design and multi-scale behavior.

courses.title: Durability of Cement-based Materials
courses.description: Develop fundamental understanding of the chemical, physical, and mechanical aspects surrounding the durability of cement-based materials.

courses.title: Linear Statistical Models in Transportation
courses.description: Theory of simple and multivariate regression and analysis of variance models. Assessment of modeling assumptions and remedial measures.  Applications in the field of transportation planning.

courses.title: Urban Transportation Planning
courses.description: An overview course on the history, finance, operations, modeling, politics, environmental impacts, and planning of urban transportation systems in the United States.

courses.title: Traffic Engineering
courses.description: Characteristics of traffic demand, traffic flow, vehicles, drivers, roadways, and pedestrians.  Studies and data analysis. Capacity analysis. Traffic control and intelligent systems.  Operations and management.

courses.title: Transportation Administration and Policy Analysis
courses.description: Overview of institutions and policy processes in the transportation sector: organizational analysis and implementation; policy analysis.

courses.title: GIS in Transportation
courses.description: Theory and application of GIS applied to transportation engineering and planning (GIS-T). Laboratory focuses on GIS-T development.

courses.title: Travel Demand Analysis
courses.description: Examination of methods for forecasting future site and regional-level travel demand. Model specification, calibration, and validation.

courses.title: Survey Design and Analysis
courses.description: Design of telephone, mail out, and personal interview survey instruments. Subsequent estimation of choice-based models from cross-sectional and panel survey data.

courses.title: Land Use - Transportation Interaction
courses.description: Overview of land use and transportation planning principles, how development impacts air transportation, how transportation investments impact development patterns and air quality.

courses.title: Transportation, Energy, and Air Quality
courses.description: Students investigate relationships between transportation demand, energy supply and consumption, fuel types, greenhouse gas emissions, and relationships between vehicle technology, pollutant emissions, modeling techniques, and air quality.

courses.title: Signalized Intersections and Networks
courses.description: Traffic-responsive signalization. Detector placement and signal timing at individual intersections.  Hands-on practice with equipment.  Timing of coordinated systems. Signal plans and specifications.

courses.title: Simulation Models in Transportation
courses.description: Simulation models in transportation: development, calibration, applications, and analysis of outputs.

courses.title: Advanced Traffic Detection and Control
courses.description: Latest developments in traffic control equipment and software, including incident management.  Communications- technology alternatives.  Video, other above-road detector technologies.  Hands-on practice with equipment.

courses.title: Transportation Safety Analysis
courses.description: Understanding the human factors elements of transportation safety, and how to appropriately model the highly complex and stochastic occurrence of accidents on a transportation network.

courses.title: Technology Innovation in Transportation
courses.description: Technology innovations in transportation including Intelligent Transportation Systems.  Planning and design of ITS systems.

courses.title: Traffic Flow Theory
courses.description: Advanced study of underlying principles and analytical procedures used in performing capacity analyses of transportation facilities.  Highway Capacity Manual procedures and other analytical techniques presented.

courses.title: Transportation Infrastructure Management and Traffic Control
courses.description: Transportation infrastructure traffic control and safety- related issues are addressed for initial implementation of transportation facilities as well as daily operational aspects.

courses.title: Transit Systems Planning and Design
courses.description: Introduction to transit system planning and design concepts. Course will discuss the planning, design, and operations of transit systems, and the operations of intermodal terminals.

courses.title: Discrete Choice Modeling
courses.description: Theory and application of probabilistic models of selection among discrete alternatives, including multinomial and nested logit and probit. Population heterogeneity. Sampling and aggregation issues.

courses.title: Infrastructure Systems Management
courses.description: Analytical approaches and tools for infrastructure and asset management, sustainable systems development.

courses.title: Infrastructure Management: IT Applications
courses.description: Introduction to information technologies (programming, database, GPS/GIS, etc.) and their applications to the life-cycle activities (e.g. design, construction, etc.) of CEE engineered systems.

courses.title: Urban Transportation Planning
courses.description: An overview course on the history, finance, operations, modeling, politics, environmental impacts, and planning of urban transportation systems in the United States.

courses.title: Urban Transportation Planning Laboratory
courses.description: Transportation planning/engineering laboratory and field experience.

courses.title: Environmental Microbial Genomics
courses.description: To introduce advanced concepts and principles of contemporary environmental microbiological research and associated bioinformatics techniques through representative examples from recent literature.

courses.title: Physical Properties and Rheology of Rocks
courses.description: Structure, properties, and rheology of minerals and rocks with applications to engineering structures and natural phenomena in the Earth. Fundamentals of rock mechanics and crack propagation. Crosslisted with EAS 6751.

courses.title: Engineering Communication
courses.description: Writing and editing engineering documents; designing and explaining visuals; creating and delivering electronic presentations.  Crosslisted with MSE 6754.

courses.title: Discovery of Signaling Molecules
courses.description: The diversity of chemical signals between organisms and their structural specificities will be presented along with chemical and biological methods for isolating signaling molecules.  Crosslisted with BIOL 6756 and CHEM 6756.

courses.title: Air Pollution Physics and Chemistry
courses.description: Introduction to physical and chemical processes affecting dynamics and fate of air pollutants at local, regional, and global scales;  emphasis on tropospheric pollutant chemistry and transport. Crosslisted with EAS 6790.

courses.title: Air Pollution Meteorology and Chemistry
courses.description: Vertical temperature and wind structure, topographic effects, natural removal processes, atmospheric dispersion of stack effluents, air pollution climatology, meteorological management of air pollution. Crosslisted with EAS 6792.

courses.title: Atmospheric Chemical Modeling
courses.description: Application of modern numerical methods to the prediction of atmospheric chemical and physical compositions; specific applications using computer models developed by the students are included. Crosslisted with EAS 6794.

courses.title: Atmospheric Aerosols
courses.description: Chemical and physical properties of natural and anthropogenic aerosols. Sources, transport, transformation, and fate of primary/secondary, organic/inorganic, atmospheric semi-volatiles and aerosols. Crosslisted with EAS 6795.

courses.title: Linear Ocean Surface Wave Mechanics
courses.description: Introduction to linear wave mechanics with emphasis on boundary value problems.  Topics include wavemakers, boundary layers, wave/current interactions, long waves, edge waves and wave forces.

courses.title: Nonlinear Ocean Surface Wave Mechanics
courses.description: Advanced solutions of nonlinear wave equations including introduction to perturbation methods, shallow and deep water solutions, nonlinear wave interactions and stream function solutions.

courses.title: Nearshore Hydrodynamics
courses.description: Introduction to surfzone hydrodynamics including properties of breaking waves, undertow, longshore currents, wave setup, rip currents, infragravity waves, shear waves, and combined wave/current boundary layers.

courses.title: Coastal Sediment Transport
courses.description: Transport of cohesive and non-cohesive sediments in tidal and surf zone environments, measurement of sediment transport, numerical modeling of sediment transport and beach evolution.

courses.title: Coastal Engineering Measurements
courses.description: Measurement of scalars (temperature, concentration), and vectors (velocity, waves), with emphasis on water and sediments.  Acoustical and optical sensors.  Quantitative use of digital video/photographic data.

courses.title: Computational Fluid Mechanics
courses.description: Numerical methods for solving the time-dependent Navier-Stokes equations in complex geometrics, including theory, implementation, and applications. Crosslisted with ME 7751.

courses.title: Fundamentals of Fracture Mechanics
courses.description: Advanced study of failure of structural materials under load, mechanics of fracture, and microscopic and macroscopic aspects of the fracture of engineering materials. Crosslisted with AE, CHE, ME, and MSE 7772.

courses.title: Fatigue of Materials and Structures
courses.description: Mechanical and microstructural aspects of nucleation and growth of cracks under cyclic loading conditions, nitch effects, cumulative damage, multiaxial loading, and fatigue crack propagation.  Crosslisted with AE, CHE, ME, and MSE 7774.

courses.title: Damage, Failure and Durability of Composite Materials
courses.description: Provide knowledge of the fundamental concepts and methods related to analysis and assessment of damage, failure and durability of composite materials. Crosslisted with AE, CHE, ME, MSE, and PTFE 7791.

courses.title: Advanced Mechanics of Composites
courses.description: Anisotropic elasticity, failure theories, hygrothermal behavior, 3-D analysis of laminates, thick laminates, free edge effects, stress concentrations, joints, creep and fracture of composites. Crosslisted with AE, CHE, ME, MSE and PTFE 7792.

courses.title: Manufacturing of Composites
courses.description: Major manufacturing techniques for metal-, ceramic-, and polymer-matrix composites.  Modeling of processes with emphasis on fundamental mechanisms and effects. Crosslisted with AE, CHE, ME, MSE and PTFE 7793.

courses.title: Geosystems Engineering Seminar
courses.description: Presentation and discussion of current research and practice developments in geosystems engineering by invited speakers, including practitioners and faculty.

courses.title: Construction Seminar
courses.description: Introduction to leading-edge industry practices not part of the regular curriculum using field trips and guest lectures.

courses.title: Environmental Engineering Seminar
courses.description: Developments in environmental engineering science and technology, current practice, current research, and special topics related to environmental quality assessment and control.

courses.title: Research Seminar in Environmental Engineering
courses.description: Discussion of current research topics in environmental engineering.  Presentations by master's and doctoral students.

courses.title: Environmental Fluid Mechanics & Water Resources Seminar
courses.description: Presentation and discussion of current research developments in environmental fluid mechanics and water resources by outside speakers, faculty, and graduate students.

courses.title: Introduction to Transportation Research
courses.description: The planning, organization and execution of professional transportation research. Topics include: human factors, safety, ethics, technical communications and the peer review process. Fulfills RCR requirements.

courses.title: Seminars in Structural Engineering, Mechanics and Materials for PhD students.
courses.description: Seminars for CEE PhD students in Structural Engineering, Mechanics and Materials (SEMM) to improve and practice technical communication skills.

courses.title: Special Topics
courses.description: Topics of current interest in civil engineering.

courses.title: Special Topics
courses.description: Topics of current interest in civil engineering.

courses.title: Special Topics
courses.description: Topics of current interest in civil engineering.

courses.title: Special Topics
courses.description: Topics of current interest in civil engineering.

courses.title: Special Topics
courses.description: Topics of current interest in civil engineering.

courses.title: Special Topics
courses.description: Special Topics for CEE (lecture and supervised lab).

courses.title: Special Topics
courses.description: Topics of current interest in civil engineering.

courses.title: Master's Special Research Project
courses.description: Master's research project to be scheduled by M.S. students not writing thesis.

courses.title: Master's Special Research Problem
courses.description: For nonthesis students performing research.

courses.title: Teaching Assistantship
courses.description: For students holding graduate teaching assistantships.

courses.title: Research Assistantship
courses.description: For students holding a graduate research assistantship.

courses.title: Preparation for Doctoral Dissertation
courses.description: For students in the preliminary stages of formulating their doctoral research program who have not obtained formal approval of dissertation topic.
